title: Bug 9619: Move static member: Dialog details
description:
Bug 9619: Move static member: Dialog details 20020212a. Mnemonics.
No validation on the type field. Type existence is not too expensive (done in the type wizard for the superclass), so it could be done. 
At least isValidTypeName function should be implemented.
The label should say 'Select destination type'.

Browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes).
Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.
Destination type can be the same as the source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
OB:
1. Browse button is too small.
2. Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
3. Only types from the source folders of the own project are shown in the dialog.
4. Destination type can be same as the source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
SR:
1. Open the dialog that allows moving a static member.
2. Observe that the browse button is too small.
3. Observe that the title is used for long text, and when going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'.
4. Observe that only types from the source folders of the own project are shown in the dialog.
5. Perform a move operation with the destination type being the same as the source type and observe that refactoring incorrectly warns about errors and makes pseudo changes in all referencing classes.
